Visual Server Administration Interface
This chapter describes how to administer the Virtuoso server from the VSP based user interface, written completely in VSP (Virtuoso Server Pages) and runs directly from the Virtuoso HTTP server. These pages primarily allow users to administer the server while giving access to many of the features that Virtuoso has to offer providing many conceptual demonstrations and introductions.
Most of the pages from the administration interface are provided to help administrators quickly and easily tune the Virtuoso server or navigate the various interfaces and features that Virtuoso has to offer.
The Menu
The menu provides links to pages that allow you to administrate your Virtuoso server or use one of the provided samples. The menu is organized into tree structures that are separated by domain of use or functionality.
The Menu
Click on the plus and minus icons to expand and contract sections of the menu to find the desired item.
Database Administration
Use this section to manage the Virtuoso Relational Database System. This module enables the management of database users; view table, view, stored procedure and trigger definitions. Virtuoso's virtual database functionality (linking to 3rd Party Database Tables, Views, and Stored Procedures) is also administered via this module.
WebDAV Administration
Configure Virtuoso's WebDAV, and HTTP Server functionality, this includes the ability to expose Persistent Stored Modules as Web Services.
Query Tools
Simple query tools for Querying Relational and XML Data using SQL, XQUERY, XPATH, and FREE TEXT.
Replication
You can create Snapshot Replications to copy sections of the Database to remote locations or use Transactional Replication to keep Virtuoso Servers in sync over a definable interval.
Mail Administration
Compose e-mail for delivery via your SMTP mail server, and retrieve mail from your POP3 server.
NNTP Administration
Configure Virtuoso's NNTP support which includes linking third-party NNTP servers into Virtuoso and controlling access to these servers. This interface also enables the creation of free-text searches on newsgroup data.
